actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 with respect to reporting of certain amounts by labor organizations.
short_title: Federal Election Campaign Act Amendments of 1984

summary.text: Federal Election Campaign Act Amendments of 1984 - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to require labor organizations to report to the Federal Election Commission expenditures for: (1) communications to their membership regarding the election of clearly identified candidates; (2) voter registration and get-out-the-vote drives directed towards their members; and (3) contributions to a segregated fund for political purposes.

titles.title: Federal Election Campaign Act Amendments of 1984
A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 with respect to reporting of certain amounts by labor organizations.
